objectives: Students will discuss family and relationships using Informal/Conversational register language
Students will engage with Sports/Competition themed scenarios related to family and relationships
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of informal level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining family and relationships content with Sports/Competition narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore family and relationships through a Sports/Competition lens using Informal/Conversational language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a competitive sports scenario involving family and relationships

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice informal register vocabulary related to family and relationships in a sports context
Students engage in sports themed role-play about family and relationships using informal register
Students create original sports themed content about family and relationships in informal register

discussion_questions: How would you describe family and relationships in a Sports/Competition scenario?
What competition or victory might be involved in family and relationships?
Can you create a Sports/Competition story about family and relationships?
How does family and relationships change when viewed through a Sports/Competition perspective?
What informal register expressions would you use to discuss this sports scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Sports/Competition situation involving family and relationships
roles: Character A: Using informal register in sports context
Character B: Responding in informal register within sports theme

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Informal/Conversational throughout: Friendly, relaxed everyday speech
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Sports/Competition theme: Athletic challenges, competition, teamwork

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Informal/Conversational register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Sports/Competition themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of informal register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
